required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Follow-Up Study of Mesenchymal Stem Cells for Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia
clinical_study.official_title: Follow-Up Study of Safety and Efficacy of Mesenchymal Stem Cells in Preterm Infants With Moderate or Severe Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia

lead_sponsor.agency: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

clinical_study.source: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a follow-up study to investigate the long-term safety and efficacy of human umbilical cord -derived mesenchymal stem cells (hUC-MSCs), for the treatment of BPD in premature infants. Subjects who participated in and completed the initial stage of the PhaseⅠtrial (NCT03558334 ) will be followed-up until 48 months after the hUC-MSCs transplantation.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects who completed the initial stage of the PhaseⅠclinical trial will be followed-up at 5 additional visits: 1, 3, 6, 12 and 24 months after the hUC-MSCs transplantation.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of the hospital stay due to respiratory infection

arm_group.description: A single intravenous transplantation of Mesenchymal Stem Cell (Dose A - 1 million cells per kg, Dose B - 5 million cells per kg)

intervention.description: Human umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stem cells had given to preterm infants through intravenous infusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject who completed the safety and efficacy evaluations in hUC-MSCs PhaseⅠ clinical trial
2. Subject with a written consent form signed by a legal representative or a parent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject whose parent or legal representative does not agree to participate in the study
2. subject who is considered inappropriate to participate the study by the investigator

overall_official.affiliation: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

facility.name: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

reference.citation: Chang YS, Ahn SY, Yoo HS, Sung SI, Choi SJ, Oh WI, Park WS. Mesenchymal stem cells for bronchopulmonary dysplasia: phase 1 dose-escalation clinical trial. J Pediatr. 2014 May;164(5):966-972.e6. doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2013.12.011. Epub 2014 Feb 6.

Ahn SY, Chang YS, Kim JH, Sung SI, Park WS. Two-Year Follow-Up Outcomes of Premature Infants Enrolled in the Phase I Trial of Mesenchymal Stem Cells Transplantation for Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia. J Pediatr. 2017 Jun;185:49-54.e2. doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2017.02.061. Epub 2017 Mar 21.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

clinical_study.keyword: human umbilical cord -derived mesenchymal stem cells
